pullRequest.title: [2.19.x] DDF-UI-185 Add metacard tag configuration for enforcing access controls
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR do?
backport of codice/ddf-ui#187
adds configuration for additional metacard tags to comply with catalogue's access control
Who is reviewing it?

Select relevant component teams:

Ask 2 committers to review/merge the PR and tag them here.
@bdeining
@Lambeaux
How should this be tested?


build / unzip
before starting ddf go into /etc/ directory, update user.attributes file to include

"test" : {
       "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress":"test@localhost.local",
       "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/role": ["manager","viewer","systembundles"]
   }

and in user.properties files add
test=test,group,manager,viewer,systembundles,ssh


login with the admin user
create new Workspace and share with other user test@localhost.local (read/write/share)
verify with other user (test as user/password) that worskspace is shared and that operations outside the permission are not allowed
repeat for result/search forms

Any background context you want to provide?
What are the relevant tickets?
codice/ddf-ui#185
Screenshots

Checklist:

 Documentation Updated
 Update / Add Threat Dragon models
 Update / Add Unit Tests
 Update / Add Integration Tests

Notes on Review Process
Please see Notes on Review Process for further guidance on requirements for merging and abbreviated reviews.
Review Comment Legend:

✏️ (Pencil) This comment is a nitpick or style suggestion, no action required for approval. This comment should provide a suggestion either as an in line code snippet or a gist.
❓ (Question Mark) This comment is to gain a clearer understanding of design or code choices, clarification is required but action may not be necessary for approval.
❗ (Exclamation Mark) This comment is critical and requires clarification or action before approval.

commit.message: [2.19.x] DDF-UI-185 Add metacard tag configuration for enforcing access controls

nodes.bodyText:
✏️  you could do something like
private final Predicate<Metacard> hasIntrigueTag = 
 metacard ->
    !metacard.getTags().retainAll(intrigueTags).isEmpty()

that way you could remove the this:: you added to the filter below on L161

commit.message: DDF-UI-185 fix test and address comments
